definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: To humble his pride, we made a plan.
sentences.chinese: 为了挫他的傲气，我们制定了一个计划。

sentences.english: Alicia is stuck-up ever since she went to college.
sentences.chinese: 阿莉西娅自从上了大学就傲气起来了。

sentences.english: The teacher's remarks humbled his pride.
sentences.chinese: 老师的一番话打掉了他的傲气。

sentences.english: Helen brought Simon down very cleverly with her remarks.
sentences.chinese: 海伦非常巧妙地用几句话大挫西蒙的傲气。

sentences.english: Love you as you fade all pride.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢你才为你褪去所有的傲气。

sentences.english: She fell in love with him, to the yellow bull.
sentences.chinese: 她心醉了，为这头傲气的黄色公牛而倾心。

sentences.english: I have a dog called HARISON that is a he-one with great pride.
sentences.chinese: 我养了一条狗，叫海尔逊，是一条傲气十足的公狗。

sentences.english: Perhaps her side with the so-called arrogance, tired of heart had to pay the price?
sentences.chinese: 也许，所谓的傲骨与傲气，都得付出心累的代价？

sentences.english: Mixed with obdurate pride and steadfast hate.
sentences.chinese: 顽固的傲气和难消的憎恨交织着。

sentences.english: And they need that ego to perform.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要傲气来表现自己。

definition: to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
